free_text.Required prior knowledge: Electrodynamics, Relativity and cosmology I, Relativistic quantum fields I
free_text.Content: - Basic facts about the Universe[br/]- Red shift and Hubble expansion[br/]- Homogeneous spaces and Friedman-Robertson-Walker metric[br/]- Open, closed and spatially flat universe[br/]- Matter dominated and radiation dominated Universe[br/]- Cosmological constant and accelerated universe expansion[br/]- Physical processes in the early Universe and the cosmic microwave[br/]background radiation[br/]- Inflationary cosmology[br/] [br/][br/]
free_text.Learning outcomes: To introduce to the students basic notions of modern cosmology

en.title: Relativity and cosmology II
en.library_recommends:
• "Gravitation and cosmology : principles and applications of the general theory of relativity / Steven Weinberg". Year:1972. ISBN:0-471-92567-5
  • "The classical theory of fields / L. D. Landau and E. M. Lifshitz". Year:2005. ISBN:0-7506-2768-9
  • "The early universe / Edward W. Kolb, Michael S. Turner". Year:1994. ISBN:0-201-62674-8

free_text.Prérequis: Electrodynamique, Relativité et cosmologie I et Champs quantiques relativistes I
free_text.Bibliographie et matériel: Ouvrages recommandés[br/]1. L. Landau, Lifshitz, "The classical Theory of Fields"[br/]2. S. Weinberg, "Gravitation and Cosmology"[br/]3. E. Kolb, M. Turner, "The Early Universe"
free_text.Contenu: - Notion de base sur l'Univers[br/]- Décalage vers le rouge et la loi de Hubble[br/]- Espaces homogènes et isotropes. Métrique de[br/]Friedman-Robertson-Walker[br/]- Equations de Friedman[br/]- Univers ouvert, fermé et plat.[br/]- Univers dominé par le rayonnement/la matière.[br/]- Constante cosmologique et l'expansion accélérée de l'Univers.[br/]- Processus physiques dans l'Univers primordial et le rayonnement[br/]cosmique fossile.[br/]- Cosmologie inflationniste.[br/]
free_text.Objectifs d'apprentissage: Initier les étudiants à la cosmologie moderne.
